SEARCH
Package ai

Class AIPlayer

java.lang.Object
model.Player
ai.AIPlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class AIPlayer extends Player
Represents an AI-controlled player in the Gomoku game.

This AI evaluates all valid moves using a scoring system that accounts for open and semi-open sequences. It selects the move with the highest strategic value, adapting dynamically to different win conditions.

Core Features:

  • Grid-based open and semi-open sequence detection
  • Dynamic win condition support (configurable win length)
  • Threat blocking and winning move detection
  • Evaluation scores bounded for consistency
  • Extension-ready: supports future Minimax or heuristic upgrades
Since:
2025-04-20

  • Method Details

    • choosePieceLocation

      public int[] choosePieceLocation(Grid grid)
      Overrides the abstract method from Player. Internally calls the smarter choosePieceLocation method with stored winLength.
      Specified by:
      choosePieceLocation in class Player
      Parameters:
      grid - the current game grid
      Returns:
      the coordinates [row, col] of the selected move

    • choosePieceLocation

      public int[] choosePieceLocation(Grid grid, int winLength)
      Determines the best move for the AI based on board evaluation. This method considers all adjacent valid empty positions on the board, simulates moves, evaluates them with a heuristic, and selects the highest-scoring one.
      Parameters:
      grid - the current game grid; must not be null
      winLength - the number of aligned pieces needed to win; must be >= 1
      Returns:
      a 2-element array [row, col] indicating the AI's selected move
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if grid is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if winLength <= 0

      Throws:

      public int getWinLength()

      Returns:
      the win condition for this AI

    • gomokuEvaluater

      private int gomokuEvaluater(Grid grid, Piece nextPiece, int winLength)
      Evaluates the potential score of placing a given piece at a location. Considers both offensive (AI's own sequences) and defensive (opponent's threats). Winning moves return Integer.MAX_VALUE, and threats are prioritized. Scoring tiers:
      • Open (n-1): +50
      • Open (n-2): +20
      • Semi-open (n-1): +30
      • Semi-open (n-2): +10
      • Block opponent win: +Integer.MAX_VALUE / 2
      Parameters:
      grid - the game board to simulate on; must not be null
      nextPiece - the piece to evaluate; must not be null, and its position must be empty on the grid
      winLength - the required number of aligned pieces to win; must be positive
      Returns:
      an integer score representing the move's potential value; higher is better
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if grid or nextPiece is null
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if nextPiece's position is outside the board
      IllegalArgumentException - if winLength <= 0 or nextPiece.getColor() is not 0 or 1

    • isOpenSequenceAt

      private boolean isOpenSequenceAt(Grid grid, int row, int col, int color, Direction dir, int length)
      Checks whether placing a hypothetical piece of the given color at the specified grid location would form an open sequence of the given length in the specified direction.

      An open sequence is a contiguous group of aligned same-colored pieces that is exactly length long and has both ends unoccupied.

      Parameters:
      grid - the game board; must not be null
      row - the row index of the simulated move; must be within grid bounds
      col - the column index of the simulated move; must be within grid bounds
      color - the color of the simulated piece; must be 0 (white) or 1 (black)
      dir - the direction to evaluate; must not be null
      length - the desired sequence length; must be positive
      Returns:
      true if an open sequence is formed, false otherwise
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if grid or dir is null
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if row or col is out of bounds
      IllegalArgumentException - if length <= 0 or color is invalid

    • isSemiOpenSequenceAt

      private boolean isSemiOpenSequenceAt(Grid grid, int row, int col, int color, Direction dir, int length)
      Checks whether placing a hypothetical piece of the given color at the specified grid location would form a semi-open sequence of the given length in the specified direction.

      A semi-open sequence is a contiguous group of aligned same-colored pieces that is exactly length long and has at least one end unoccupied.

      Parameters:
      grid - the game board
      row - the row index of the simulated move
      col - the column index of the simulated move
      color - the color of the simulated piece (e.g., 0 for white, 1 for black)
      dir - the direction in which to evaluate alignment
      length - the number of aligned pieces to consider
      Returns:
      true if a semi-open sequence would be formed, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified position is outside the board

    • isSequenceOfType

      private boolean isSequenceOfType(Grid grid, int row, int col, int color, Direction dir, int length, AIPlayer.SequenceType type)
      Evaluates whether a simulated move at the given coordinates would result in either an open or semi-open sequence of a specified length, depending on the chosen AIPlayer.SequenceType.

      A sequence is defined as a consecutive line of same-colored pieces in the specified direction. An open sequence requires both ends of the line to be unoccupied (null), while a semi-open sequence requires at least one open end.

      Validation & Safety:
      • Throws NullPointerException if the grid is null
      • Throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the coordinates are outside the board
      • Throws IllegalArgumentException if length is non-positive, color is invalid, or direction/type is null
      Parameters:
      grid - the game board
      row - the row index of the simulated move
      col - the column index of the simulated move
      color - the color of the simulated piece (must be 0 or 1)
      dir - the direction to check for alignment (must not be null)
      length - the exact sequence length to check (must be positive)
      type - the sequence type to test (OPEN or SEMI_OPEN)
      Returns:
      true if the corresponding sequence is formed, false otherwise
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if grid is null
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified position is outside the grid bounds
      IllegalArgumentException - if length <= 0, color is invalid, or if dir or type is null
